 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==the outside==, sometimes, especially in plural, specifically a street, never with suffix in singular, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ָ  ה‎</span> locative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח֫וּצָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֻ֫צָה‎</span>, plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצוֺת‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֻצוֺת‎</span>, with suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצֹתָיו‎</span> etc., [[Isa.15.3|Isa 15:3]] etc.; — 

**1.** ***the outside***, of a house, tent, city, camp, etc., often used, especially with prepositions, to express the adverb idea of ***outside, abroad*** (Aramaic synonym, except in sense **2 a**, is <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּר‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as accusative after verb of motion [[Deut.23.13|Deut 23:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָצָא חוּץ‎</span> to go forth outside (that is, a camp), v.[[Deut.23.14|Deut 23:14]] (as adverb accusative) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ‎</span> ***outside***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הוֺצִיא הַחוּץ‎</span> to bring forth ***outside*** (a house or chamber) [[Judg.19.25|Judg 19:25]]; [[2Sam.13.18|2Sam 13:18]] compare [[Neh.13.8|Neh 13:8]]; [[Judg.12.9|Judg 12:9]]b <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּנוֺת הֵבִיא לְבָנָיו מִןהַֿחוּץ‎</span> from ***outside***, from ***abroad***, [[2Kgs.4.3|2Kgs 4:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁאֲלִילָֿךְ כֵּלִים מִןהַֿחוּץ‎</span> from ***outside*** (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּבַּיִת‎</span> v[[2Kgs.4.2|2Kgs 4:2]]); as genitive [[Lev.18.9|Lev 18:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺלֶדֶת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ‎</span> one born ***abroad*** (i.e. by another father or mother, of a half-sister: opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺלֶדֶת בַּיִת‎</span>) [[Ezek.47.2|Ezek 47:2]] (twice in verse). With <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ָ  ה‎</span> locative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצָה‎</span>, after a verb of motion [[Exod.12.46|Exod 12:46]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִןהַֿבַּיִת ֗֗֗ חוּצָה‎</span>, [[Prov.5.16|Prov 5:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצָה לָעִיר‎</span> ***outside of*** the city, [[Num.35.4|Num 35:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִקִּיר הָעִיר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָחוּצָה‎</span> from the wall of the city ***and outwards***; = ***on the outside, without*** [[1Kgs.6.6|1Kgs 6:6]]; [[Isa.33.7|Isa 33:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צָֽעֲקוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצָה‎</span> cry ***without***, [[2Chr.24.8|2Chr 24:8]]: so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַחוּצָה‎</span> [[Gen.15.5|Gen 15:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיּוֺצֵא אֹתוֺ הח‎</span> and brought him ***outside***, [[Gen.19.17|Gen 19:17]]; [[Gen.24.29|Gen 24:29]]; [[Josh.2.19|Josh 2:19]] +, [[1Kgs.8.8|1Kgs 8:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא יֵרָאוּ הַחוּצָה‎</span> were not seen ***towards the outside***, [[Deut.25.5|Deut 25:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמֵּת הַחוּצָה לְאִישׁ זָר‎</span>i.e. shall not be married into another family, compare [[Judg.12.9|Judg 12:9]] a. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** with preps.: ***a.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלהֿחוץ‎</span> ***towards the outside*** [[Ezek.41.9|Ezek 41:9]], [[Ezek.34.21|Ezek 34:21]] pleonastic <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלהֿחוצה‎</span>. ***b.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בחוץ‎</span> [[Gen.9.22|Gen 9:22]] ***outside*** (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּתוֺךְ אָהֳלֹה‎</span> v[[Gen.9.21|Gen 9:21]]), [[Gen.24.31|Gen 24:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמָּה תַעֲמֹד בַּחוץ‎</span>, [[Deut.24.11|Deut 24:11]]; [[Exod.21.19|Exod 21:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אם יקום והתהלך בחוץ‎</span> (after leaving a sick couch), [[2Kgs.10.24|2Kgs 10:24]]; [[Ps.31.12|Ps 31:12]]; [[Ezek.7.15|Ezek 7:15]] (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִבַּיִת‎</span>), [[Hos.7.1|Hos 7:1]] +. ***c.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לחוץ‎</span> [[Ps.41.7|Ps 41:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יצא לחוץ‎</span>; = ***on the outside*** [[Ezek.41.17|Ezek 41:17]]; [[Ezek.42.7|Ezek 42:7]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַחוּצָה‎</span> [[2Chr.32.5|2Chr 32:5]] ***towards the outside***. ***d.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִחוּץ‎</span> ***on*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> **3 c**) ***the outside*** [[Ezek.40.19|Ezek 40:19]]; [[Ezek.46.2|Ezek 46:2]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִבַיִת וּמִחוּץ‎</span> within and ***without*** (of an ark, building, etc.) [[Gen.6.14|Gen 6:14]]; [[Exod.25.11|Exod 25:11]] = [[Exod.37.2|Exod 37:2]]; [[1Kgs.7.9|1Kgs 7:9]]; [[Deut.32.25|Deut 32:25]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מחוץ תְּשַׁכֶּלחֶֿרֶב‎</span> (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יּמֵחֲדָרִים‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵימָה‎</span>), [[Lam.1.20|Lam 1:20]] (compare [[Ezek.7.15|Ezek 7:15]] above ***b***); so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵהַחוּץ‎</span> [[Ezek.41.25|Ezek 41:25]]. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִחוּץ לְ‎</span> ***on the outside of***, [[Gen.19.16|Gen 19:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּנִּיחֵהוּ מִחוּץ לָעִיר‎</span>, [[Gen.24.11|Gen 24:11]]; [[Exod.26.35|Exod 26:35]]; [[Exod.37.7|Exod 37:7]] (twice in verse); [[Lev.8.17|Lev 8:17]]; [[Lev.14.8|Lev 14:8]]; [[Num.35.5|Num 35:5]]; [[Josh.6.23|Josh 6:23]]; [[Jer.21.4|Jer 21:4]] +, even after a verb of motion [[1Kgs.21.13|1Kgs 21:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיּוֺצִיאוּהוּ מִחוּץ לְעִיר‎</span>, [[2Kgs.23.6|2Kgs 23:6]], though in this case <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל מחוץל‎</span> is more common, [[Lev.4.12|Lev 4:12]]; [[Lev.4.21|Lev 4:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אל מחוץ למחנה‎</span>, [[Lev.6.4|Lev 6:4]]; [[Lev.10.4|Lev 10:4]]; [[Lev.14.40|Lev 14:40]]; [[Lev.14.41|Lev 14:41]] + often [[BDB#P|P]], [[Deut.23.11|Deut 23:11]]. ***e.*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִחוּצָה‎</span> [[Ezek.40.40|Ezek 40:40]] ***on the outside***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִחוּצָה לְ‎</span> v[[Ezek.40.44|Ezek 40:44]]. ***f.*** (late) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ מִן‎</span> ***outside of***, [[Eccl.2.25|Eccl 2:25]] who can eat, and who enjoy, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ מִמֶּנִּיִ‎</span> ***outside of*** me, i.e. ***except*** me? (but read rather, with [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Now|Now]] and others, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ מִמֶּנּוּ‎</span> ***apart from, without*** him, i.e. God). (So Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ מִן‎</span> ***except, without***, see [[BDB#De|De]]<sup>[[Eccl.2.25|Eccl 2:25]].</sup> compare The Aramaic synonym <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בַּר מִן‎</span> ***except*** [[Exod.20.3|Exod 20:3]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]; ***apart from, without*** [[Isa.36.10|Isa 36:10]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id***.)

**2.** Of a definite locality, namely 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** that which is outside the houses of a town, i.e. ***a street*** [[Isa.51.23|Isa 51:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּחוּץ לַעֹבְרִים‎</span>, [[Jer.37.21|Jer 37:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּץ הָאֹפִים‎</span> the Bakers' ***street***, [[Prov.1.20|Prov 1:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּחוּץ‎</span>, (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּֽרְחֹבוֺת‎</span>: so [[Prov.7.12|Prov 7:12]]; [[Prov.22.13|Prov 22:13]]; [[Jer.9.20|Jer 9:20]]); often in plural, as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּצֹת אַשְׁקְלוֹן‎</span> the ***streets*** of Ashkelon [[2Sam.1.20|2Sam 1:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ירושׁלם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ח‎</span> [[Jer.5.1|Jer 5:1]]; [[Jer.7.17|Jer 7:17]]; [[Jer.7.34|Jer 7:34]] + often Jeremiah; [[1Kgs.20.34|1Kgs 20:34]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְחֻצוֺת תָּשִׂיםלְֿךָ בְּדַמֶּשֶׂק‎</span> and ***streets*** (i.e. bazaars) shalt thou make thee in D., as my father made in Samaria (a concession involving the right of trading), [[Amos.5.16|Amos 5:16]]; [[Isa.15.3|Isa 15:3]]; [[Isa.24.11|Isa 24:11]] (as scene of mourning), [[Isa.5.25|Isa 5:25]]; [[Jer.51.4|Jer 51:4]]; [[Ezek.11.6|Ezek 11:6]]; [[Ezek.28.23|Ezek 28:23]] ( as filled with corpses of slain), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּראֹשׁ כָּלחֿוּצוֺת‎</span> i.e. in conspicuous places, [[Nah.3.10|Nah 3:10]]; [[Lam.2.19|Lam 2:19]]; [[Lam.4.1|Lam 4:1]]; [[Isa.51.20|Isa 51:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טִיט חוּצוֺת‎</span> mire of ***streets*** [[Zech.10.5|Zech 10:5]] (trampled on by warriors), in simile, of foes trodden under foot, [[Ps.18.43|Ps 18:43]]; [[Mic.7.10|Mic 7:10]] ( so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּחֹמֶר ח‎</span> [[Isa.10.6|Isa 10:6]]), metaphor of cheapness and abundance [[Zech.9.3|Zech 9:3]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** more generally, ==that which is outside enclosed cities, the open country==, [[Job.18.17|Job 18:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלאֹ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁם לוֺ עַלפְּֿנֵיחֿוּץ‎</span> (see [[BDB#De|De]]), compare [[Prov.24.27|Prov 24:27]] in the plural [[Job.5.10|Job 5:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְשֹׁלֵחַ מַיִם עַל פְנֵי חוּצוֺת‎</span>, [[Prov.8.26|Prov 8:26]]; [[Ps.144.13|Ps 144:13]] (as place where flocks abound).
